page.title: 05THE VILLAGE SHOP - EDDERTON
page.content: {The Village Shop},the only one in the village,is over 100 years old.It sells {Confectionary,Food and General {Household Goods.}There is also a{Post {Office}in the shop.Three people including the owners work there.They all live in the village.It is open 7 hours a day but is closed on Wednesday and Saturday afternoon and all day Sunday.Thursday is usually the busiest day because the pensions are paid that day.To stock the shop the owner goes to Inverness to a cash and carry and buys the goods in bulk.He also orders over the telephone and has it delivered to the shop by lorry.Most people come to buy food.The problems with running a small shop are not enough trade,competition from the supermarket in the towns,lack of population and people wanting credit. There is very little passing trade.
